premise_source_doc_sentence: Glenn Close  (  born March 19 , 1947  )  is an American actress , singer and film producer .

claim: Glenn Close began her professional acting career in 1988.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Close began her professional stage career in 1974 in Love for Love , and was mostly a New York stage actress through the rest of the 1970s and early 1980s , appearing in both plays and musicals , including the Broadway productions of Barnum in 1980 and The Real Thing in 1983 , for which she won the Tony Award for Best Actress in a Play .

claim: Glenn Close began her professional acting career in 1988.
premise_source_doc_sentence: Her film debut was in The World According to Garp  (  1982  )  , which she followed up with supporting roles in The Big Chill  (  1983  )  and The Natural  (  1984  )  ; all three earned her nominations for the Academy Award for Best Supporting Actress .
